result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. THOMPSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Possess THC w/ Intent to deliver as repeater(>1000-2500 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy M. THOMPSON
Current: 2025 Main Street, Apt. D, New Holstein, WI 53061 United States  (Effective: 08-14-2017)
Prior: 719 Magnolia Avenue, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.
All records scanned and verified.

Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Wisconsin State Prisons and Extended Supervision.   
Duplicate original delivered to Registrar.  Copy to DOC and Sheriff.
$4,000.00 cash bail returned to Michael Thompson by check instruction No. CR 127.

Transcript of plea and sentencing hearing held on 09-05-14.  
Copy of transcript delivered to Registrar with defendant.

Order for Return of Bond. 
It is hereby ordered that the Clerk of Courts for Manitowoc County shall release the cash bond previously posted in this matter to Michael Thompson.
Cover Letter.
Letter from Attorney Richard L. Kaiser.

Attorney Kaiser is requesting an adjournment of the plea date.  He needs to obtain additional information regarding the defendant's probation in Nevada and how this plea will affect that.  He is hoping this can be resolved in 30 days.
Plea date is reset to 09-05-14 at 2:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Defense counsel needs more time to get through additional discovery.  Plea date reset to 07-31-14 at 10:00 a.m.  
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 05-22-2014 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-3.
At 7:35 p.m., $4,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
At 12:47 p.m. search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Detective Adam Sohlden, Manitowoc City Police Department.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-25-14 at 3:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 05-22-14 at 3:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-01-14 at 8:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $4,000.00 cash.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.   
Minutes.

RE:  PTC possess THC with intent to deliver as repeater, on 03-06-14.
Initial appearance is set for 03-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  US Cellular, phone number 920-905-1400 from January 1,2014 at 12:00 a.m. through March 6,2014 at 11:59 p.m.
At 11:49 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
Search warrant issued.  RE: 2307B Jackson Street, Two Rivers, WI.
